TRANSFER MARKET
NBA stars react to Al-Hilal’s mega offer... and Mbappé responds!
PSG have accepted a world record fee for the 24-year-old and sports stars around the world shake their heads in disbelief.



Andy Hall
Update:  Jul 25th, 2023 05:45 EDT

0




Nike


The saga surrounding Kylian Mbappé's future took a new twist this week as it emerged that Paris Saint-Germain have given the thumbs up to an eye-watering offer from the Saudi Pro League. Al-Hilal tabled a huge €300 million ($332.4 million) bid for the 24-year-old, who has entered the final year of his contract at PSG.
If Mbappé agrees terms with Al-Hilal and the deal goes through, he will become the most expensive signing in football history. But it’s a proposal that will have given the striker plenty to think about bearing in mind his own ambitions and career goals. He has won all of the domestic honours possible in France but has his eyes on bigger prizes - and he has still yet to win the biggest of all at club level, the Champions League. Not to mention the Ballon d’Or...
You might also enjoy

Mbappé's incredible Al Hilal offer put into perspective

Barça reveal why Mbappé move won't happen

Lucrative Apple deal helps Messi move to MLS


Some reports claim that Al-Hilal would be willing to negotiate a one-year deal and allow Mbappé the freedom to move on to fulfill his ambitions in one of Europe’s major leagues although that seems unlikely. There aren’t many clubs around that can actually afford him - Real Madrid could meet his wages but only if he arrives on a free next summer.
The news of Al-Hilal’s monster offer for the France international has drawn opinions from across the sporting world, and not just in football. LeBron James was the third best-paid player in the NBA last season and to put Al-Hilal’s offer into context, the $776 million that Kylian could potentially earn in just one season in Saudi Arabia exceeds the total earnings that James has amassed in 20 seasons in the NBA - $531 million.
But LeBron sees the funny side and posted a gif of Forrest Gump haring down a country lane and into the distance, captioned: “Me headed to Saudi when they call (Klutch Sports CEO) Rich Paul and (James’ business manager) Maverick Carter for that 1 year deal!”
Me headed to Saudi when they call @RichPaul4 & @mavcarter for that 1 year deal! ✌‍♂️ pic.twitter.com/IX0VSMZYNb
— LeBron James (@KingJames) July 25, 2023


Meanwhile Warriors  forward Draymond Green tittered, “They got basketball leagues too right? I don’t the ink on my contract has dried up yet!”
They got basketball leagues too right?  I don’t the ink on my contract has dried up yet 
— Draymond Green (@Money23Green) July 25, 2023


LIGUE 1
Mbappé and the other ‘undesirables’ at PSG




PSG
PSG explode: Mbappé places the final straw on the Qatari camel's back





And they weren’t alone. Here’s a look at some of the other reactions to Al-Hilal’s offer - including a response from Mbappé himself!
1 year 776mm? Wtf lol ...
— Damian Lillard (@Dame_Lillard) July 24, 2023


Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe  pic.twitter.com/VH0syez3VX
— Giannis Antetokounmpo (@Giannis_An34) July 24, 2023


He’s too young to semi-retire, surely? https://t.co/3elI1eJhjv
— Gary Lineker (@GaryLineker) July 24, 2023


 https://t.co/hKhqYXC7tH
— Kylian Mbappé (@KMbappe) July 24, 2023

<div class="art__bo is-unfolded" dtm-region="articulo_eng_soccer_cuerpo_none_none_none"><p class="">The saga surrounding <b>Kylian Mbappé's future</b> took a new twist this week as it emerged that Paris Saint-Germain have given the thumbs up to an eye-watering offer from the Saudi Pro League. <b>Al-Hilal</b> tabled a huge <b>€300 million</b> ($332.4 million) bid for the 24-year-old, who has entered the final year of his contract at <b>PSG</b>.</p>
<p class="">If <b>Mbappé </b>agrees terms with <b>Al-Hilal </b>and the deal goes through, he will become the most expensive signing in football history. But it’s a proposal that will have given the striker plenty to think about bearing in mind his own ambitions and career goals. He has won all of the domestic honours possible in France but has his eyes on bigger prizes - and he has still yet to win the biggest of all at club level, the <b>Champions League</b>. Not to mention the Ballon d’Or...</p>
<figure class="ext ext-in"><h2 class="ext-in__tl">You might also enjoy</h2>
<div><ul>
<li><a href="https://en.as.com/soccer/how-does-kylian-mbappes-potential-al-hilal-contract-compare-to-lebron-brady-and-mahomes-earnings-n/" target="_blank"><strong>Mbappé's incredible Al Hilal offer put into perspective</strong></a></li>

<li><a href="https://en.as.com/soccer/barcelona-reveal-why-they-wont-be-signing-paris-saint-germain-superstar-kylian-mbappe-n/" target="_blank"><strong>Barça reveal why Mbappé move won't happen</strong></a></li>

<li><a href="https://en.as.com/soccer/how-the-mls-apple-deal-helped-lionel-messi-join-inter-miami-n/" target="_blank"><strong>Lucrative Apple deal helps Messi move to MLS</strong></a></li>

</ul></div>
</figure><p class="">Some reports claim that <b>Al-Hilal </b>would be willing to negotiate a one-year deal and allow <b>Mbappé </b>the freedom to move on to fulfill his ambitions in one of Europe’s major leagues although that seems unlikely. There aren’t many clubs around that can actually afford him - <b>Real Madrid</b> could meet his wages but only if he arrives on a free next summer.</p>
<p class="">The news of Al-Hilal’s monster offer for the France international has drawn opinions from across the sporting world, and not just in football. <b>LeBron James</b> was the third best-paid player in the NBA last season and to put Al-Hilal’s offer into context, the <b>$776 million</b> that Kylian could potentially earn in just one season in <b>Saudi Arabia</b> exceeds the total earnings that James has amassed in 20 seasons in the NBA - <b>$531 million</b>.</p>
<p class="">But <b>LeBron </b>sees the funny side and posted a gif of <i><b>Forrest Gump</b></i> haring down a country lane and into the distance, captioned: “Me headed to Saudi when they call (Klutch Sports CEO) Rich Paul and (James’ business manager) Maverick Carter for that 1 year deal!”</p>
<div data-oembed-type="twitter" class="ext ext-embed"><blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Me headed to Saudi when they call <a href="https://twitter.com/RichPaul4?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">@RichPaul4</a> & <a href="https://twitter.com/mavcarter?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">@mavcarter</a> for that 1 year deal! ✌‍♂️ <a href="https://t.co/IX0VSMZYNb" target="_blank">pic.twitter.com/IX0VSMZYNb</a></p>
— LeBron James (@KingJames) <a href="https://twitter.com/KingJames/status/1683634303203422209?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">July 25, 2023</a></blockquote>

</div>
<p class="">Meanwhile Warriors  forward <b>Draymond Green</b> tittered, “They got basketball leagues too right? I don’t the ink on my contract has dried up yet!”</p>
<div data-oembed-type="twitter" class="ext ext-embed"><blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">They got basketball leagues too right?  I don’t the ink on my contract has dried up yet </p>
— Draymond Green (@Money23Green) <a href="https://twitter.com/Money23Green/status/1683642982463950848?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">July 25, 2023</a></blockquote>

</div>
